item.title: FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time sales top 1.5 million
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Milestone achieved just over seven months after relase.

Total sales for slow-life RPG FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time have surpassed 1.5 million units, just over seven months after release, publisher LEVEL-5 and developer LEVEL-5 Osaka announced.

FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on May 21 worldwide, followed by Switch 2 on June 5. It sold 500,000 copies within its first two days of release, 800,000 copies within 10 days, one million copies by June 12, 1.2 million copies by July 7, and 1.4 million copies by September 25.

The major free major update “The Sinister Broker Bazario’s Schemes” launched on December 24, introducing a new roguelike game mode where each run offers varied rewards that can be brought back to the main game.

item.title: Daemon Bride: Additional Gain for PC launches December 30
item.content:encoded:
• PC

A battle of angels and demons.

The PC version of 2D fighting game Daemon Bride: Additional Gain will launch via Steam on December 30 for 2,980 yen, developer Team ARCANA announced. It will be available at a 10 percent-off discount price until January 14, 2026. It will support English and Japanese language options.

Daemon Bride: Additional Gain, an upgraded version of the July 16, 2009-released original Daemon Bride, first launched in Japanese arcades on November 24, 2011.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

In 2025, the popular arcade game Daemon Bride is back on Steam!

A fighting game depicting the battle between 17 angels and demons.

Enjoy high-speed, deep battles with flashy bullets and powerful special moves.

In addition, the rollback-compatible net code allows for smooth online battles.

Angels, demons, and humans.

The destinies of each are intricately intertwined, and Tokyo becomes the stage for the battle.

The opening bell is the oath of the contract. In sealed-off Tokyo, the contract holders dance.

The PC version will also offer the following additional features:

  • The first-ever home port from the arcade version.
  • Smooth online battles with rollback netcode.
  • Boss character Dies Irae Deus joins the roster as a competitive play-only playable character.
  • Includes 16:9 widescreen support alongside the original 4:3 screen ratio. It also supports high resolution via custom upscaling.
  • Training mode and in-game guidebook “Primer of Duel.”
